docs.snippet: Critics contend that the verdicts in two highly publicized sexual assault cases this week reflect a military command that bowed to political pressure and brought bad cases to trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: Critics contend that the verdicts in two highly publicized sexual assault cases this week reflect a military command that bowed to political pressure and brought bad cases to trial.
docs.abstract: News analysis; critics argue that outcomes of two highly-publicized military sexual assault cases reflect a military command that has bowed to political pressure and brought bad cases to trial; Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair was given a slap on the wrist and former Naval Academy football player Joshua Tate was found not guilty.

headline.main: Two Cases, One Conclusion on Military Justice
headline.print_headline: Two Cases, One Conclusion on Military Justice
